Description: Fragment of brown linen, weft-faced plain weave textile with paired tapestry (single warp threads) band; From a tunic sleeve; Decorated with a central panel of foliate ornament between toothed bands/dotted borders; Foliate pattern is woven in blue wool against a light ground; Warp: S spun, c.10 tpc; Weft: S spun, c.26-28 tpc in plain areas, c.35-42 in tapestry; Edges: one selvedge, three cord lines (?) of groups of warp thread, probably also some reinforcing in weft; Many weaving faults.
Curator's comments: Previous location Gallery 41, case 19; Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (12.7.1989)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
